intro: Myosotis media, commonly known as the common forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and has hairy stems and leaves. Its flowers are often arranged in clusters and are attractive to pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Myosotis media is often found in moist meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks.
